title: Champagne Flute, "Lobmeyr's Gentlemen's Dinner", 1871
provenance: Between 1880 and 1905, some 1,500 guests--among them architects, politicians, scientists, and artists--were invited to Ludwig Lobmeyr's dinner parties, where this set was used.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Dale and Doug Anderson, Anonymous Donor, Arthur Liu, and Prairie Pictures, Inc. and from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: Mouth-blown crystal, partly facet-cut and polished, with a dainty floral engraved border

participants.person_name: J. & L. Lobmeyr GmbH, Vienna, Austria

exhibitions.title: Ted Muehling Selects: Lobmeyr Glass from the Permanent Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Champagne Flute, "Lobmeyr's Gentlemen's Dinner", 1871.
1871. Glass. Museum purchase through gift of Dale and Doug Anderson, Anonymous Donor, Arthur Liu, and Prairie Pictures, Inc. and from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund. 2009-18-45.
